page.title: 08WINTERINGHAM INNS
page.content: The two inns are the Ferry Boat and the Bay Horse. The latter, near the southern end of Ferry Lane claims to be the original Ferry Boat Inn, the name having changed last century when the present Ferry Boat took over the name. The original Ferry Boat has been the major judicial,commercial and soc- ial centre for centuries. Records exist for an auction of farms in 1791, for a master for a village school in 1802 and for Court Leet hearings in 1827.A regular meeting place for vill- agers today, when, on any fine evening as many young people gather outside, as the older inside, in the 17th cent- tury cockfighting was a spectacle on the same ground.The present Ferry Boat dismisses the flimsy evidence of name- change proudly pointing to the main beam of the bar, a ships mast, as in- dicating it is the original & genuine.
